title: How to Use a Kindle Paperwhite

steps.title: Familiarize yourself with the Kindle's hardware features.
steps.content: Familiarize yourself with the Kindle's hardware features. There are only two main hardware features you need to be aware of, both of which are located at the bottom of the Kindle's housing: [1] X Research source Power button — This small, circular button is used to turn on and off the Kindle. It's to the right of the "Kindle" logo. Charging port — This small, rectangular port is used to charge the Kindle's battery. You'll find it to the left of the "Kindle" logo.

steps.title: Understand how to interact with on-screen items.
steps.content: Understand how to interact with on-screen items. Like any other tablet, you can select options on your Kindle's screen by tapping them. Tapping a text field (e.g., a search bar) will bring up an on-screen keyboard that you can use to type in information. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Charge
steps.content: Charge your Kindle if necessary. If you haven't yet charged your Kindle, plug one end of the charger cable into a wall outlet (or, if you're missing the wall adapter, a charging USB port on a computer), then plug the free end of the cable into the microUSB port on the bottom of the Kindle. Things like screen brightness, frequency of use, and app usage will determine your Kindle's battery's lifespan.

steps.title: Turn on your Kindle.
steps.content: Turn on your Kindle. Press once the Power button on the bottom of the Kindle to do so. If your Kindle was off or sleeping, this will prompt it to turn on. [3] X Research source If you ever need to turn off your Kindle, you can press and hold the Power button for around seven seconds until the Kindle's screen goes blank. Holding down the Power button for 20 seconds will prompt the Kindle to restart.

steps.title: Go to the Home Screen if needed.
steps.content: Go to the Home Screen if needed. If your Kindle opens to something other than the Home Screen, you can access the Home Screen by tapping the top of the screen and then tapping the house-shaped Home icon. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Set Up Your Kindle.
steps.content: Tap Set Up Your Kindle . It's on the Home Screen. Doing so brings up the setup menu.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen prompts. The order of information you'll need to enter may vary, but you'll usually need to fill out forms for each of the following features: [5] X Research source Language — Select the language with which you want to use your Kindle. Date and time — Select a time zone, region, date, and/or local time. Wi-Fi — Select a wireless Internet network to use, then enter the password when prompted. Amazon account — Enter your Amazon account's email address and password to log into it on your Kindle.

steps.title: Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi. You'll need to be connected to the Internet in order to download a book. [6] X Research source You should still be connected to Wi-Fi from when you set up your Kindle.

steps.title: Open the toolbar.
steps.content: Open the toolbar. Tap the top of the screen to do so. You should see a toolbar appear there.

steps.title: Tap the "Store" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Store" icon. It's a cart-shaped icon in the toolbar. Doing so opens the eBook Store.

steps.title: Find a book you want to buy.
steps.content: Find a book you want to buy. Scroll through the list of popular books, or tap the search bar at the top of the page and then use the on-screen keyboard to type in the name of the book you want to buy.

steps.title: Select the book.
steps.content: Select the book. Tap the book you want to buy to do so. This will open its page.

steps.title: Tap Buy.
steps.content: Tap Buy . It's in the middle of the screen. Doing so purchases the book using your Amazon account's preferred payment method. The book will begin downloading onto your Kindle.

steps.title: Wait for the book to finish downloading.
steps.content: Wait for the book to finish downloading. This should take less than a minute. Once the book is done downloading, you can proceed with reading the book .

steps.title: Transfer an existing book.
steps.content: Transfer an existing book. If you have an eBook that you purchased through Amazon on a computer or another Kindle, you can download it onto your current Kindle by doing the following: [7] X Research source Open the toolbar. Tap Home in the top-left side of the toolbar. Tap Cloud in the top-left side of the Home Screen. Select the book you want to download. Follow any on-screen prompts to download the item.

steps.title: Remove a book if necessary.
steps.content: Remove a book if necessary. If you have an eBook that's taking up space on your Kindle, you can remove it from your Kindle without deleting it from your Amazon account: Find the book you want to remove on the Home Screen. Tap and hold the book's cover. Tap Remove from Device when prompted. Confirm your decision if asked.

steps.title: Return to the Home Screen if needed.
steps.content: Return to the Home Screen if needed. Tap the top of the screen to bring up the toolbar, then tap the house-shaped Home icon. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap My Items.
steps.content: Tap My Items . It's at the top of the screen. A menu will appear. Skip this step and the next one if you want to look for something other than a book (e.g., a magazine).

steps.title: Tap Books.
steps.content: Tap Books . This is in the menu. Doing so filters your Home Screen contents to display only books.

steps.title: Select a book.
steps.content: Select a book. Tap the book you want to read to do so. This will open the book to the last page you had open.

steps.title: Turn a page.
steps.content: Turn a page. Tap the middle of the screen to turn to the next page.

steps.title: Go back a page.
steps.content: Go back a page. If you want to go to the previous page, tap the far-left side of the screen.

steps.title: Bring up the toolbar.
steps.content: Bring up the toolbar. Tap the very top of the Kindle's screen to view the toolbar. You'll see this toolbar drop down from the top of the screen.

steps.title: Review the toolbar's contents.
steps.content: Review the toolbar's contents. While the toolbar's contents may vary depending on what you're reading, you'll usually see the following options from left to right: Home — Tapping this house-shaped icon will take you back to your Kindle's Home Screen. Back — Tapping this backward arrow-shaped icon will go back a page (for example, if you're in a menu, tapping this goes back to the last page in the menu). Brightness — Tapping this light bulb-shaped icon will bring up a slider that you can drag left or right to decrease or increase your Kindle's brightness. Store — Tapping this cart-shaped icon will open the eBook Store from which you can purchase new content. Search — Tapping this magnifying glass-shaped icon will open the search bar which you can use to search your book (or an open page) for a specific word or phrase. Menu — Tapping this three-line icon (☰) will open the menu from which you can select different Kindle-related options (e.g., Settings ). Secondary menu items you'll see when reading a book include the Aa option, the Go To option, the X-Ray option, and the Share option. Aa brings up the font preferences, Go To and X-Ray allow you to search your book for specific options, and Share links to social media.

steps.title: Return to the Home Screen when necessary.
steps.content: Return to the Home Screen when necessary. Once you're ready to go back to the Home Screen from your book, tap the top of the screen to open the toolbar and then tap the house-shaped Home icon.

steps.title: Understand what a collection is.
steps.content: Understand what a collection is. A collection is essentially a folder in which you store a group of books. Creating a collection can help declutter your Kindle's Home Screen if you have a bunch of books that you want to organize.

steps.title: Go to the Home Screen.
steps.content: Go to the Home Screen. Tap the top of the screen to bring up the toolbar, then tap the house-shaped Home icon to open the Home Screen.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the Home Screen. A menu will appear. You may first have to tap the top of the screen again to open the toolbar.

steps.title: Tap Create New Collection.
steps.content: Tap Create New Collection . It's in the menu. Doing so opens a list of your available books.

steps.title: Select books to add.
steps.content: Select books to add. Tap the name of each book you want to add to your collection. You should see a checkmark appear next to each book you tap.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's at the top of the screen. This will save your collection and add the books to it. You can view the collection on the Home Screen by tapping it there.
